meanings.definition: One of the segments of an arthropod body.
meanings.sent1: The mesomere of the insect's body was clearly defined.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the mesomere of the beetle closely.
meanings.sent3: The mesomere of the ant seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: The mesomere of the spider was like a tiny puzzle piece in its body.
meanings.sent5: The bright color of the mesomere made it stand out among the other segments.

meanings.definition: A segment of a developing embryo.
meanings.sent1: The mesomere of the growing chick was carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: During development, the mesomere of the fetus becomes more distinct.
meanings.sent3: The mesomere of the embryo seemed to be dancing under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The mesomere of the seed was like a hidden treasure waiting to sprout.
meanings.sent5: The delicate nature of the mesomere highlighted the miracle of life.
